name: ReHability
description:
ReHability is a serious game proof of concept aimed at aiding stroke patients in their rehabilitation through both physical and cognitive training tasks.

UNIVERSITY OF CHESTER PROJECT DETAILS

ReHability was created as part of our experiential learning module. In this module students work in teams to complete a project for a real world client. They are required to work 30 hours a week for 6 weeks to simulate working in a studio or company. Students were given the opportunity to work with a research team exploring virtual reality (VR) for medical training/rehabilitation.

CONTROLS

  • Vive controllers or Oculus Touch controllers

REQUIREMENTS

  • Windows PC
  • HTC Vive and controllers or Oculus Rift plus Touch controllers

TEAM MEMBERS

  • 7 x Level 5 Students

COURSE DETAILS

The work presented here is that of our students. Although the page is run by the University of Chester, views in the games do not necessarily represent those of the University of Chester.
